intro: Iris biflora f. lisbonensis, commonly known as the Lisbon iris, is a hybrid form of the iris genus native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers with a distinctive white or pale yellow center. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats. It features slender, upright stems and broad, sword-shaped leaves. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
